creator: dgerdt@bju.edu
text:
Created attachment 22675
simple leader with leader-pattern="rule"

I use leaders in some places as horizontal rules to separate sections of a document. I recently realized that they are not getting drawn in my PCL output. They appear correctly in PDFs, but not in PCL.

The space for the leader is consumed, but the line is not drawn. Attached is a file that demonstrates the problem.

Problem appears in 0.95 and trunk (rev 699739).

creator: bowditch_chris@hotmail.com
text:
Have you read the section on configuring the PCL Renderer here:

http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/fop/0.95/output.html#pcl

Does changing the text-rendering or rendering settings have any affect on the leader lines?

Yes, I read this section. Unfortunately, I'm not seeing any change by setting rendering to quality or text-rendering to bitmap.

Thanks for the suggestion.

I've just added minimal support for this in FOP Trunk:
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=706319&view=rev

I will do a more complete implementation as part of the "new intermediate format" work.

Full leader painting support (with the help of the Java2D implementation) is now available through the new intermediate format painter, currently residing in a development branch:
